content: As an AI language model, I don't have access to current information or specific details about Clemson University's projects or initiatives related to sustainable agriculture. However, I can tell you that Clemson University's Cooperative Extension Service offers educational programs and resources to growers and consumers that promote sustainable agriculture practices, including promoting conservation tillage, crop rotation, integrated pest management, water and energy conservation, and soil health management. In addition, Clemson's School of Agriculture, Forestry, and Environmental Sciences conducts research on sustainable agriculture practices and technologies to improve crop yields, reduce waste, and enhance soil health. Some of Clemson's partnerships with government agencies, non-profit organizations, and industry partners have resulted in programs to promote local food systems, agroforestry, urban agriculture, and sustainable livestock production.
